001package io.github.ai4ci.functions;
002
003import java.io.Serializable;
004
005import org.immutables.value.Value;
006import org.mariuszgromada.math.mxparser.Argument;
007import org.mariuszgromada.math.mxparser.Expression;
008import org.mariuszgromada.math.mxparser.mXparser;
009
010import com.fasterxml.jackson.annotation.JsonIgnore;
011import com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.annotation.JsonDeserialize;
012import com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.annotation.JsonSerialize;
013
014/**
015 * A mathematical function that can be evaluated at runtime. This is used to
016 * represent functions that are defined by the user as part of the configuration
017 * of the model, such as the viral load to transmission probability mapping.
018 *
019 * <p>
020 * The function is defined by a String expression containing `x` as the
021 * parameter, which is parsed and evaluated using the mXparser library. The
022 * parsed expression is derived from the original String and is not serialized,
023 * ensuring that only the user-defined expression is stored in the
024 * configuration.
025 *
026 * @see io.github.ai4ci.abm.OutbreakBaseline#transmissibilityFromViralLoad(double,
027 *      double)
028 */
029@Value.Immutable
030@JsonSerialize(as = ImmutableMathematicalFunction.class)
031@JsonDeserialize(as = ImmutableMathematicalFunction.class)
032public interface MathematicalFunction extends Serializable, SimpleFunction {
033
034        /**
035         * A univariate mathematical function as a String containing `x` as the
036         * parameter. Supported expressions are described here:
037         * https://mathparser.org/mxparser-math-collection
038         *
039         * @return the function expression.
040         */
041        String getFXExpression();
042
043        /**
044         * The parsed expression ready for evaluation. This is derived from the
045         * `fxExpression` and is not serialized. It is configured to disable rounding
046         * to ensure accurate calculations.
047         *
048         * @return the parsed expression.
049         */
050        @JsonIgnore @Value.Derived
051        default Expression getParsed() {
052                mXparser.disableUlpRounding();
053                mXparser.disableCanonicalRounding();
054                mXparser.disableAlmostIntRounding();
055                var x = this.getXArgument();
056                return new Expression(this.getFXExpression(), x);
057        }
058
059        /**
060         * The following methods are derived from the expression and are not
061         * serialized. They provide a convenient way to evaluate the function at
062         * runtime.
063         *
064         * @return the argument representing `x`.
065         */
066        @JsonIgnore @Value.Derived
067        default Argument getXArgument() { return new Argument("x"); }
068
069        /**
070         * Evaluates the function at a given value of `x`.
071         *
072         * @param x the value to evaluate the function at.
073         * @return the result of the function evaluation.
074         */
075        @Override
076        default double value(double x) {
077                var xArg = this.getXArgument();
078                xArg.setArgumentValue(x);
079                var result = this.getParsed().calculate();
080                return result;
081        }
082
083}
